javier,

Tuesday, September 19, 2006, 10:36:20 PM, you wrote:

jsc> Tan solo quer�a compartir con ustedes lo siguiente: 





jsc> EXPLORE MAZES OF FATE� ON THE GAME BOY ADVANCE�



jsc> First-Ever Latin American GBA Game Provides Hours of
jsc> First-Person Role-Playing Entertainment





jsc> �

jsc> SUNNYVALE, CA--Sep 19, 2006 -- Signature Devices, Inc.�
jsc> (www.signaturedevices.com )(Other OTC: SDVI.PK - News) wholly
jsc> owned video game development and publishing subsidiary Graffiti
jsc> Entertainment, LLC (www.GraffitiEntertainment.com)� has released
jsc> for manufacturing "Mazes of Fate," a Role Playing Game (RPG) for
jsc> the Game Boy� Advance hand-held video game system. It expects to
jsc> have it on retailers' shelves around October 15, 2006 with an
jsc> MSRP of $29.99. 



jsc> �

jsc> �Graffiti Entertainment is pleased to be the first to bring
jsc> the work of a fine young developer like Sabarasa to the North
jsc> American market,� said Kenneth Hurley, CEO of both Signature
jsc> Devices and Graffiti Entertainment. �Mazes of Fate is an amazing
jsc> piece of work, and it�s something that both serious RPG fans and
jsc> more casual players will enjoy.�



jsc> �

jsc> Sabarasa, an Argentine developer, is the first Latin
jsc> American company to produce a game for a Nintendo console. To
jsc> develop Mazes of Fate, Sabarasa has examined several classic
jsc> RPGs, trying to distill the essence of what made those games so
jsc> playable and popular. Using them for inspiration, they have
jsc> crafted an epic RPG that should appeal to new fans and hardcore
jsc> gamers alike.



jsc> �

jsc> Dimitri Criona, Graffiti Entertainment's Director of Sales,
jsc> says, "One of the most exciting and stable genres for video games
jsc> is the Role Playing Games category. 'Mazes of Fate' for Game Boy
jsc> Advance provides players a 'traditional' RPG through fifty
jsc> different levels. There is no question that this game will
jsc> provide even the most avid gamers with many hours of high-quality
jsc> entertainment." 



jsc> �

jsc> Mazes, which has been in development since March of 2003,
jsc> is set in a dark fantasy world that is facing divine punishment.
jsc> The ancient gods, disgusted by humanity�s pride, intend to wipe
jsc> mankind out and replace it with a new, more submissive race of
jsc> goatmen. One party of adventurers is left to make the ultimate
jsc> choice. Should they fight back against overwhelming odds, or
jsc> sentence humanity to a fate that may be worse than death?



jsc> �

jsc> Mazes of Fate spans the length and breadth of a huge,
jsc> dynamic world, and tells an epic story of magic and conspiracy,
jsc> with more than a hundred characters you can interact with, an
jsc> hour of original music featuring thirty-five different themes,
jsc> and twenty-five hours of gameplay.



jsc> �

jsc> You will explore dungeons, solve intricate puzzles, and go
jsc> on multiple quests with a party of up to three adventurers. You
jsc> can select your protagonist from one of three pre-made
jsc> characters, or create your own, then seek out and recruit six
jsc> unlockable allies for your crew. The adventurers can be
jsc> customized as you see fit, using nineteen skills, forty magical
jsc> spells from three different schools of magic, and more than three
jsc> hundred items and equipment to find and use.



jsc> �

jsc> You will need all the advantages you can get to overcome
jsc> hundreds of monsters, unravel the secrets of the gods� plot, and
jsc> battle your way to the point where you must make the Final
jsc> Decision that will determine the fate of the world.



jsc> �

jsc> Mazes of Fate will ship in five languages � English,
jsc> French, Spanish, German, and Italian, which you can switch
jsc> between during gameplay using the in-game Options menu � when it
jsc> is released this winter.



jsc> �

jsc> Mazes of Fate is rated T (Teen) by the ESRB, with the
jsc> following descriptors: blood, the use of alcohol, and mild
jsc> fantasy violence.



jsc> �

jsc> About Signature Devices, Inc. and Graffiti Entertainment LLC: 



jsc> Based in Sunnyvale, Calif., Signature Devices, Inc.
jsc> (www.signaturedevices.com) and its wholly owned subsidiary
jsc> Grafitti Entertainment, LLC (www.GraffitiEntertainment.com) are a
jsc> full-service developer and publisher of interactive entertainment
jsc> software for advanced entertainment consoles.� Its focus is on
jsc> creating, developing, and publishing trend-setting titles with
jsc> mass-market appeal.





jsc> �

jsc> Sabarasa Entertainment is one of the leading game
jsc> development companies of Argentina. It produces games for both
jsc> the local and international market in all media types including
jsc> PC, mobile phones, Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS. Their goal
jsc> is to establish themselves as an international game development
jsc> company creating products of the highest quality, through
jsc> strategic partnerships with international companies. For more
jsc> information, please visit www.sabarasa.com

jsc>
